text: one of the biggest advantages that we've
seen using AWS we've been able to try
new business models and actually spin up
new projects very quickly
and its really taking a lot of the risk
out of us being able to do that hi my
name is Chris Rome's and I'm the senior
director of engineering for the Autodesk
consumer group Autodesk is a software
provider for engineering and design
software products like AutoCAD and Revit
and inventor and 3ds Max and Maya the
consumer product group started about two
years ago and we've identified some
opportunities to repurpose that
technology for the use of consumers
things like drawing painting sketching
photo editing and tools for people doing
3d modeling for home projects and
do-it-yourself type of applications when
we first started looking for a new IT
environment the goal was to be able to
cloud enable a lot of legacy
applications but also develop some new
applications some of the challenges we
were hoping to to overcome is we want to
be able to spin up projects quickly we
wanted to be able to scale we had a
number of different legacy applications
that we wanted to put in the cloud and
then integrate them we have a number of
different ways that we leveraged Amazon
Web Services we have a family of
products called the one-two 3d products
that are enabling makers to be able to
do 3d design and do personal design and
fabrication from mobile applications to
desktop applications and browser-based
web applications and it also includes an
ecosystem that we build out using AWS
services in the cloud we use the ec2 for
hosting a lot of the servers we have
something on the order of eighteen to
twenty servers as a baseline and then we
scale from there we use s3 for a lot of
content we have users upload their own
content and then we have content that we
provide we do this worldwide and so we
use CDN as a good way for us to do that
we don't have to worry about the
hardware infrastructure and some of the
low level technology that we would
normally have to put in the budget and
plan for hire for we're really moving to
a situation where we want to do a lot
more subscription model having our data
in the cloud having our users cloud
connected
is really the only way that we can do
that I think probably the biggest
surprise for us in moving into AWS and
moving our applications into the cloud
is just how easy it's been to spin up
the whole process not just production
but developer environments staging
environments and moving into a
production deployment using AWS enabled
us to take a lot of applications and
services that we've had that have been
traditional desktop applications and put
it in a place where our customers are I
think that's been a huge benefit to
moving into AWS for our company
